summary: Having spent nearly 10 most exciting years in scientific research (physical, organic, medicinal chemistry, material science, nanotechnology) of which 5 under the guidance of the 2016 Nobel Prize Laureate, I am now focused on the educational aspects of science and technology. In my nearly six years at the Inholland University of Applied Sciences I taught a range of undergraduate chemistry courses, supervised students' internship and graduation projects, mentored students, developed and coordinated a new Polymer Chemistry minor and acted as graduation and internationalization coordinator. Now, in my capacity as Assistant Professor within the MERLN Institute at the Maastricht University I am taking on a challenge of coordinating the design and development of a new undergraduate study program in the field of Regenerative Medicine and Technology. I am also involved in ongoing teaching and research activities (focus: photoresponsive biomaterials) within the institute and the university.
